content.text: A parser reads input and converts it into a structure that a program can understand. In this lesson, you will build a simple parser that evaluates basic arithmetic expressions like '2 + 3'.
Parsing involves breaking the input into tokens, understanding the order of operations, and computing the result. Even a simple parser helps you understand how interpreters work under the hood.

content.prompt: Split the string '2 + 3' into its components (number, operator, number) and print them.

content.text: After tokenizing, you can convert numbers from strings to integers and perform the operation indicated by the operator. This is the simplest form of evaluation.
